dt: {bc}a physical or mental competition conducted according to rules with the participants in direct opposition to each other
{bc}the manner of playing in a contest
{bc}a particular aspect or phase of play in a game or sport
{bc}the set of rules governing a game
{bc}the number of points necessary to win
{bc}points scored in certain card {a_link|games} (as in all fours) by a player whose cards count up the highest
{bc}any activity undertaken or regarded as a contest involving rivalry, strategy, or struggle
{bc}the course or period of such an activity

dt.t: got into aviation early in the {wi}game{/wi}

dt: {bc}activity engaged in for diversion or amusement {bc}{sx|play||}
{bc}a procedure or strategy for gaining an end {bc}{sx|tactic||}
{bc}an illegal or shady scheme or maneuver {bc}{sx|racket||}
{bc}animals under pursuit or taken in hunting
{bc}wild animals hunted for sport or food
{bc}a target or object especially of ridicule or attack
often used in the phrase {it}fair game{/it}

pt: {sc}fun{/sc} {sc}jest{/sc} {sc}sport{/sc} {sc}game{/sc} {sc}play{/sc} mean action or speech that provides amusement or arouses laughter. {sc}fun{/sc} usually implies laughter or gaiety but may imply merely a lack of serious or ulterior purpose.
{sc}jest{/sc} implies lack of earnestness and may suggest a hoaxing or teasing.

pt.t: hurt by remarks said only in {it}jest{/it}

pt: {sc}sport{/sc} applies especially to the arousing of laughter against someone.

pt.t: teasing begun in {it}sport{/it} led to anger

pt: {sc}game{/sc} is close to {sc}sport{/sc}, and often stresses mischievous or malicious fun.
{sc}play{/sc} stresses the opposition to {it}earnest{/it} without implying any malice or mischief.

pt.t: pretended to strangle his brother in {it}play{/it}

et: Middle English {it}game, gamen{/it} "delight, amusement, play, contest, pursuit of animals in sport," going back to Old English {it}gamen, gomen{/it} "amusement, jest, pastime," going back to Germanic {it}*gamano-{/it} (whence Old Saxon & Old High German {it}gaman{/it} "amusement," Old Norse {it}gaman{/it} "sport, amusement"), of uncertain origin
shortdef: a physical or mental competition conducted according to rules with the participants in direct opposition to each other
a division of a larger contest
the manner of playing in a contest

dt: {bc}to manipulate, exploit, or cheat in (a system, a situation, etc.) slyly or dishonestly for personal gain

dt.t: … a male bus driver who tried to {wi}game{/wi} a drug test by using his wife's urine …
Globally [in 2019], more than two billion people play video games, including 150 million Americans (nearly half the country's population), 60 percent of whom {wi}game{/wi} daily.
Is it the interest of any man to steal, to {wi}game{/wi}, to waste his health and mental faculties by drunkenness …? No. All these are roads to ruin.

shortdef: to manipulate, exploit, or cheat in (a system, a situation, etc.) slyly or dishonestly for personal gain
to play for a stake : gamble

ins.il: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}an ancient Panhellenic festival held every fourth year and made up of contests of sports, music, and literature with the victor's prize a crown of wild olive
{bc}a modified revival of the ancient Olympic Games consisting of international athletic contests that are held at separate winter and summer gatherings at four year intervals

shortdef: an ancient Panhellenic festival held every fourth year and made up of contests of sports, music, and literature with the victor's prize a crown of wild olive
a modified revival of the ancient Olympic Games consisting of international athletic contests that are held at separate winter and summer gatherings at four year intervals —called also Olympics

dt: {bc}actions that are meant to confuse or upset someone in order to get an advantage

dt.t: I couldn't handle the {it}head games{/it} that came with the job anymore.
She's known for playing {it}mind games{/it} with her opponents.

shortdef: actions that are meant to confuse or upset someone in order to get an advantage

dt: {bc}a series of international athletic contests held in a different country once every four years

shortdef: a series of international athletic contests held in a different country once every four years

dt: {bc}a usually coin-operated game designed for play at an {d_link|amusement arcade|amusement arcade}

shortdef: a usually coin-operated game designed for play at an amusement arcade
a game played with a ball
